intro: Culcitium oligocephalum, commonly known as the narrow-headed culcitium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its small, green leaves and delicate, pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
